business.headline: Explained: Why the IMF is under fire for $1 billion loan to PakistanThe disbursement, approved on Friday under the Extended Fund Facility (EFF), raises total payouts under the programme to $2.1 billion. But the timing of the announcement has provoked a fierce backlash.

India–Pakistan tensions escalate. What's next for Dalal Street investors?While the Sensex and Nifty ended over 1% lower in the previous session, experts suggest that the decline was far less than what could have been expected in such a volatile environment.

Nirmala Sitharama asks banks to stay on alert amid rising Indo-Pak tensionsThe directive comes a day after India successfully intercepted multiple missile and drone attacks launched from Pakistan late on May 8. While India reported no major damage, the government has since asked all critical institutions to bolster their cybersecurity infrastructure in anticipation of potential retaliatory attacks.
'Unsupportive stance towards India': Go Homestays ends ties with Turkish AirlinesGo Homestays ends ties with Turkish Airlines after Turkey backs Pakistan following 'Operation Sindoor'.

India-Pak tensions: Oil PSUs assure ample fuel stocks, urge against panic buyingIndian oil companies have issued statements assuring ample fuel stocks across the country. The Indian Oil Corporation and Bharat Petroleum Corporation Limited have emphasised that there is no shortage of petrol, diesel, CNG, or LPG.

Bharti Airtel in talks to acquire 49% stake in Haier India: ReportSunil Mittal, the billionaire-founder of Indian telecom operator Bharti Airtel, has partnered with private equity firm, Warburg Pincus to buy a substantial stake in Haier India.

Telecom regulator recommends 5-year satellite spectrum allotment: ReportThe move comes amid growing interest in satellite internet services from global players like Elon Musk's Starlink and domestic telecom giants.
Sensex closes 880 points lower, Nifty above 24,000; Titan ends 4% upThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 880.34 points to end at 79,454.47, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 265.80 points to close at 24,008.00.

Essential goods supply to remain unaffected across India amid geopolitical heatPrices of key food items, including pulses and vegetables, are being watched closely to make sure they stay under control. Efforts are also being made to keep the supply of these items steady across all cities.

Planning an FD in 2025? Check these 6 banks offering attractive interest ratesFor fixed deposits between 15 and 21 months, HDFC Bank is offering 7.05% to general citizens, while senior citizens get 7.55%

Finance Minister to review cyber readiness of banks, financial institutionsThe meeting will bring together representatives from several key institutions like the Reserve Bank of India (RBI), the National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI), the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE), the National Stock Exchange (NSE), etc.
Explained: Why Yes Bank share price jumped over 7% todayThe Yes Bank stock has now gained nearly 11% over the past five sessions, sparking investor curiosity.

Bitcoin crosses $100,000 again, as US-UK trade deal lifts market moodThe announcement of a fresh trade deal between US President Donald Trump and UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer helped lift market mood across sectors and gave crypto investors an added reason to feel positive.

YES Securities raises Paytm target to Rs 975 on profitability turnaround and surge in merchant lendingContribution margin rises to 56.1%, EBITDA turns positive before ESOP costs, and merchant loan volumes gain traction under DLG model.

Equity mutual fund inflows hit 1-year low in April amid tariff worries, says AMFIIndia's equity mutual fund inflows eased for a fourth month in April, dropping to Rs 242.69 billion, the weakest level in a year, reveals AMFI data.

Sensex tumbles 800 points: Why is the stock market falling today?The BSE Sensex was trading 722.62 points lower at 79,612.19 around 11:57 am, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 221.05 points to trade barely above 24,000. Most of the broader market indices also fell during the trading session as volatility surged due to the ongoing military escalations.

Indian Oil assures public of fuel stock: No need for panic buyingIndian Oil Corporation Limited (IOCL) requested the public to stay calm and avoid unnecessary rush at petrol pumps amid rising tensions between India and Pakistan.

Star Health hacker claims sending bullets and death threats to top executivesIn the recent email, xenZen said he had sent two packages in February to the company's main office in Chennai. These packages reportedly contained bullet cartridges and threatening notes warning of further violence.
Titan share price jumps over 4% after strong Q4 numbers. Should you buy?Titan's share price surged 4.95% to reach the day's high of Rs 3,530 on the BSE, compared to the previous close of Rs 3,363.45.

Drone stocks light up Dalal Street, rally up to 17% amid Indo-Pak tensionsShares of ideaforge Technology jumped nearly 17% to Rs 450 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) after Indian forces deployed suicide drones to neutralise air defence systems in Lahore and Multan. Meanwhile, Droneacharya gained 5%, ZEN Technologies advanced 5%, and Paras Defence rose almost 5% in intraday trade.

India likely to caution IMF against fresh financial support to Pakistan: ReportIndia seems to be sending a message that simply handing out money to Pakistan won't solve the deeper issues, especially when terrorism and poor handling of previous funds remain concerns.

HAL, BEL, Bharat Dynamics: Defence stocks rally up to 7% amid Indo-Pak tensionsShares of Hindustan Aeronautics (HAL), Bharat Dynamics (BDL), Bharat Electronics Ltd (BEL), and Paras Defence jumped between 2 and 7% in Friday's trade, outperforming a jittery broader market shaken by geopolitical uncertainty.

India-Pakistan tension: What should investors do as Sensex, Nifty trade in red?At 9:43 am, the S&P BSE Sensex had fallen by 507.64 points to 79,827.17, while the NSE Nifty50 dropped 160 points to 24,113.80. Most shares and sectors were trading lower, with only a few managing to stay in the green.

Markets volatile but no crash on D-Street amid Indo-Pak tensions. 3 things to knowThe Sensex dropped over 500 points within minutes, and the Nifty wasn't far behind. But despite the panic-inducing headlines, the market didn't spiral into chaos.
Market opens volatile amid India-Pakistan tension; Sensex down over 500 pointsSensex falls 500 points, Nifty falls as Indo-Pak tensions spook Dalal Street

Stock market highlights: Sensex ends 880 points lower, Nifty holds above 24,000Share market: Investor sentiment has been dampened by rising border tensions between India and Pakistan as Dalal Street has taken a hit. However, experts have still asked investors not to panic.

Stock market opening: Will Sensex, Nifty crash today amid Indo-Pak tension?Gift Nifty futures were trading at 23,987 as of 6:46 am, which suggests that the Nifty50 could open nearly 1.2% below Thursday's close of 24,273.8.

Stocks to watch today: HAL, Swiggy, Titan, Zee, MCX, Bharat Forge, L&TDefence sector stocks such as Hindustan Aeronautics Ltd (HAL), Bharat Forge, and Bharat Dynamics Ltd (BDL) are likely to remain in focus.

EPFO to speed up higher pension applications, payouts likely by year-end: ReportThe EPFO has received about 1.75 million applications from pensioners who want to get a higher pension based on their actual wages, out of a total of 7.8 million pensioners.

Explained: Why Sensex, Nifty fell sharply moments before stock market closingBy market close, the BSE Sensex had dropped 411.97 points to 80,334.81, while the Nifty 50 fell 140.60 points to 24,273.80. The India VIX, often seen as the market's fear gauge, spiked over 10 per cent to cross the 21 mark—its highest since early April.

Reliance withdraws 'Operation Sindoor' trademark, says it was filed inadvertentlyOn May 7, four different applications were made to trademark the phrase 'Operation Sindoor' under Class 41 of the Nice Classification. This category includes services like films, shows, online content, education, cultural events and more.

Kamikaze 'suicide' drone maker's stock jumps after 'Operation Sindoor'. Details hereListed on the NASDAQ under the ticker ESLT, Elbit's stock rose 3.62% over two sessions, jumping from $400.00 on May 6 to $414.47 by May 8.

Sensex, Nifty end in red as panic grows over India-Pak tensionsThe S&P BSE Sensex had fallen over 700 points just a few minutes before closing. However, it bounced back to end 412 points lower at 80,334.81, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 140.60 points to close at 24,273.80.

Pakistan's Karachi Stock Exchange crashes 7%, trading haltedAccording to the official notification from the exchange, trading was paused after the benchmark index plunged 6.3% in a short period. The sharp fall triggered automatic circuit breakers to stop further decline.

ITR Filing 2025: What is ITR Form 3, check eliigibility, documents and deadlinesYou should file ITR-3 if you run a business or work as a self-employed professional, regardless of whether a tax audit is needed.

India-Pak tensions lift Chinese jet maker's stock by 36% in 2 daysAs of Thursday, the company's share price rose by 16.37% to reach 80.68 yuan. This was after a 17% jump on Wednesday. In total, the stock has gained 36.21% in two days and has gone up 44% in the past one month.

'Retirement age is moving from 60 to 45': An investment banker explains whyUnlike lawyers or doctors, where experience adds value, senior professionals in corporate roles like sales, marketing, operations, product, and tech, are seen as costly and sometimes out of touch, said the investment banker.

Why stock market investors shouldn't panic amid rising Indo-Pak tensionsWhile 'Operation Sindoor' led to worries about increased market volatility and losses, the main indices on Dalal Street actually managed to end in green in the previous session. Even today, the stock markets are trading in positive territory.

Pakistan's forex is slipping fast. More trouble ahead for already debt-ridden economy?A bailout by the International Monetary Fund (IMF), including a loan of $2 billion in March this year, gave Pakistan some breathing room. But the current situation could undo much of that progress.

'You can now automate strategies': Zerodha's Nithin Kamath on NSE's new algo rulesZerodha's founder and CEO, Nithin Kamath, hailed NSE's new rules to ease algo trading for retail users and explained the main update in simple terms.

entertainment.headline: Mahesh Babu to share stage with Rajamouli, Jr NTR, Ram Charan at RRR London eventMahesh Babu will join the 'RRR' team members SS Rajamouli, Jr NTR and Ram Charan at the Royal Albert Hall in London on Sunday. Composer MM Keeravaani will perform with a live orchestra at the 'RRR' screening.

Samantha on having 'worst thoughts' over divorce, health issues: Didn't act on themActor Samantha Ruth Prabhu, in a recent interview, talked about having the 'worst possible thoughts' for a year. She further added that she chickened out and didn't want to act on these thoughts.

Aamir Khan, Ranveer Singh and celebs remember makeup artist Vikram GaikwadPopular Bollywood makeup artist Vikram Gaikwad died on Saturday. Aamir Khan, Ranveer Singh, Anushka Sharma and several others paid tribute to him.

Sanam Teri Kasam's directors say no more engagement with Pak actors: Nation first'Sanam Teri Kasam' directors Radhika Rao and Vinay Sapru, in an interview, stated that no one from India should work with Pakistan actors. The duo lashed out at Pakistan actors for their statements against Indian Armed Forces and Operation Sindoor.

Salman honours 'best mothers', Allu Arjun's sweet wishes: Celebs on Mother's DayIndian cinema's biggest stars, Salman Khan, Allu Arjun and several others honoured their mothers on Mother's Day on their respective social media pages. From heartfelt photos to emotional messages, the film fraternity celebrated the special day with love and gratitude.

Preity Zinta is 'finally home', apologises to Dharamshala match crowd: Was bit curt Actor and Punjab Kings owner Preity Zinta shared a long note on X, announcing that she had reached home safely. She also apologised for turning down the crowd at the Dharamshala stadium when they asked for a picture.

Shehzad Khan criticises paparazzi culture: People with no talent chase the papsVeteran actor Shehzad Khan spoke against the growing paparazzi culture dominating the entertainment world. He highlighted the importance of talent and privacy over public spectacle in his exclusive interview with India Today Digital.

Govinda's wife Sunita Ahuja says any 'stupid woman' can't make him 'leave family'Bollywood couple Govinda and Sunita Ahuja released in a statement that they had been working on their marriage after rumours of their divorce went viral earlier this year. Now, Sunita spoke to the media to clarify the rumours.

Rajinikanth congratulates PM, Amit Shah and armed forces for successful Op SindoorSuperstar Rajinikanth congratulated Prime Minister Narendra Modi, Home Minister Amit Shah and our armed forces for striking terror bases in Pakistan. He also spoke highly of our army, navy and airforce.

Neil Nitin Mukesh on young actors: All of them are upping their game | ExclusiveNeil Nitin Mukesh shares his admiration for young Bollywood actors, naming Vicky Kaushal, Kartik Aaryan and others as promising talents. He also reflects on recent films that impressed him and his passion for watching movies.

Ranveer Allahbadia deletes post for 'Pakistani brothers-sisters' after backlashPodcaster Ranveer Allahbadia is at the centre of a new controversy for making an Instagram post addressed to 'dear Pakistani brothers and sisters' amid India's Operation Sindoor against terrorism. He deleted the post later following criticism on social media.

Samantha says fans asked her for a pic on the day my dad died: I never say noActor Samantha Ruth Prabhu, in a recent interview, talked about how she never says no when fans ask her for a picture. She recalled the incident when a fan approached her for a photo when she was on her way to Chennai to attend her father's funeral.

Ram Charan's wax statue with pet dog Rhyme unveiled in London. WatchRam Charan and his pet dog, Rhyme's statues, were unveiled in London. Their statues will be kept on display at Madame Tussauds Singapore.

She moves mountains for her children: Bollywood celebs share what a mother meansCinema has been celebrating motherhood since its inception in India. And every shade of motherhood finds a place in Indian films. On International Mother's Day 2025, we asked Bollywood celebs how they define a mother.

Ace trailer: Vijay Sethupathi powers through heist film with style and swagActors Vijay Sethupathi and Rukmini Vasanth have joined hands for director Arumugakumar's heist thriller. The trailer was launched by Sivakarthikeyan on Sunday.

Actor Ravi Mohan, rumoured partner Kenishaa attend reception amid heavy trollingActor Ravi Mohan and his rumoured partner Kenishaa made yet another public appearance at producer Ishari Ganesh's daughter's wedding reception in Chennai. This comes a day after the two were trolled for their appearance amid Ravi's divorce battle with wife Aarti.

Samantha recalls 'shaking' on Oo Antava sets: Who thinks of me for a special song?Samantha reminisced about dancing in front of '500 junior artistes' on the sets of the 'Oo Antava' song in 'Pushpa'. She said she took it as an opportunity and did it even when she was 'shaking' out of nervousness.

Taylor Swift's team blasts Justin Baldoni over subpoena in Blake Lively caseThe representatives of Taylor Swift's team talked to the media and criticised actor Justin Baldoni for involving her in his lawsuit against Blake Lively. The team called this a 'tabloid clickbait move'.

Did Salman Khan make a post on India-Pakistan ceasefire and later delete it?Several screenshots of Salman Khan's X-post about the India-Pakistan ceasefire are going viral on social media. It seems like the Bollywood superstar posted about the ceasefire on Saturday and deleted it later.

general news.headline: Indian Navy was in position to strike Karachi, reveals Vice Admiral on Op SindoorIndia launched Operation Sindoor on May 7 against the terror hideouts inside Pakistan and POK in retaliation to the Pahalgam attack. Indian forces destroyed major terror infrastructure in precision strikes.

India releases names of Pak Army personnel, cops who attended terrorists' funeralVideos and images of the funerals of terrorists surfaced on social media, showing several Pakistani Army officials and personnel attending the terrorists' last rites in different parts of border areas.

'Just a trailer': Ex-Air Chief Marshal on India's strikes in Pak terror campsRetired Air Chief Marshal RKS Bhadauria described India's Operation Sindoor as an 'immense success' that achieved all its targets, and called it just a 'trailer' of what India is capable of if provoked further.

Few Pak jets downed, no wreckage as planes stopped from entering: IndiaIndia shot down several advanced Pakistani jets and inflicted significant losses while thwarting a military escalation following Operation Sindoor.

A dangerous India-Pak asymmetry amid fragile truceThere's a dangerous asymmetry between India and Pakistan. While India is led by a civilian leadership that will keep citizen's best interests in mind, Pakistan's real ruler is General Asim Munir, who could go to any extent to satisfy the deep state. This is crucial as a tenuous truce, tested within hours by Munir's men, takes effect.

Congress invokes Indira Gandhi to slam PM for 'US mediation', BJP has a responseThe US's announcement of an India-Pakistan de-escalation understanding triggered a political firestorm in India, with the Congress party invoking Indira Gandhi's decisive leadership during the 1971 Bangladesh Liberation War.

Zelenskyy 'ready to meet Putin' after Trump tells him not to await ceasefireUkrainian President Zelenskyy agreed to meet Putin in Turkey after Trump urged immediate talks, neglecting an immediate ceasefire. Russia offers direct negotiations, while Ukraine and Europe have pushed for a 30-day truce first.

Operation Sindoor goals achieved, all pilots returned: Indian defence forcesWhile the army refrained from disclosing specific operational details such as numbers, platforms used, or exact targets, citing ongoing security concerns, the leadership assured that strategic goals had been met.

Watch: Before and after India's missile struck key terror camps in PakistanThe Armed Forces showed detailed missile impact videos from the operation, including visuals of successful strikes on terror camps at Muridke and Bahawalpur.

13 killed, several injured as truck rams trailer in ChhattisgarhA truck collided with a trailer in Chhattisgarh, killing at least 13 people. 11 others were injured and taken to Raipur Medical College for immediate treatment.

What India said on avoiding use of 'ceasefire' amid tensions with PakEven as Trump hailed the agreement as a ceasefire, neither India nor Pakistan used the term. Hours after an understanding was reached, Pakistan violated it with heavy firing and shelling towards India.

Pak lost every battle, realised they are not in this league: India on Op SindoorOperation Sindoor has sent a clear message to Pakistan, with the country losing every battle against India, government sources said while explaining the outcome of India's military action.

How fragile ceasefire underlines India-Pakistan fault linesWith Pakistan firing drones and missiles within hours of the agreement, all eyes are fixated on the scheduled talks between the DGMOs of the two sides on May 12

Live: Explosions in Udhampur false, no drones spotted in J&K, says governmentIndia-Pakistan Tension Live Updates: India accused Pakistan of ceasefire violation hours after foreign secretary Vikram Misri announced that India and Pakistan had reached an understanding to stop all firings and military actions on land, air and sea with immediate effect late on Saturday. However, the situation along the LoC is stable now while western border states are on high alert. PM Modi is currently having a security meeting with NSA Ajit Doval, Defence minister Rajnath Singh, CDS Anil Chauhan and military chiefs. India and Pakistan agreed to halt military actions hours after intense cross-border strikes. The escalation followed India's Operation Sindoor, launched in response to the April 22 Pahalgam terror attack that killed 26 people.
5 Indian soldiers killed under Operation Sindoor, says ArmyThe Indian Army, in a press conference on Sunday, confirmed that five soldiers were killed in Operation Sindoor.

Barcelona cleansweep Real Madrid in 2024-25, win 7-goal thrillerBarcelona overcame a 0-2 deficit to defeat Real Madrid 4-3 in a thrilling LaLiga match. This win strengthens their lead and boosts hopes of clinching the LaLiga title despite recent Champions League disappointment.

Emmanuel Macron, Keir Starmer caught on cam at alleged cocaine party? Here's the truthA viral video sparked claims that French President Emmanuel Macron hid a cocaine pouch during the Ukraine visit. The French media debunked the rumour, calling it an "absurd conspiracy" and confirming the object was just a handkerchief.

Taliban bans chess in Afghanistan, calls it against ShariaThe Taliban has suspended chess in Afghanistan, calling it a form of gambling banned under Sharia law. A sports official said the game won't return until religious concerns are resolved.

Amazon India's Great Summer Sale 2025 is here: Transform your garden with upto 60% off on lawn & garden essentialsMake your Garden and Lawn summer ready with Amazon India's Great Summer Sale 2025 that is live now. Enjoy Up to 60% off on Lawn & Garden Essentials such as Plants, Solar Lights and more.

Trump to sign executive order to cut prescription drug prices up to 80%Donald Trump announced he will sign an executive order to reduce prescription drug prices, aiming to match the costs paid by high-income countries. The "most favoured nation" policy seeks to bring fairness to US pricing, saving taxpayers billions.

Did Pakistan put Australian cricketers in harm's way while striking India?Pakistan has used civilian aircraft as shields while attacking India with drones. Reports that international cricketers took off just hours ago from the Nur Khan military airbase in Rawalpindi before it was hit, tallies with India's charge.

Hamas to free Edan Alexander, last known living American hostage in GazaHamas is set to release Israeli-American soldier Edan Alexander. Mediators Qatar and Egypt call it encouraging as efforts continue to end the war and secure the release of other hostages.
21 killed, over 35 injured as bus falls off cliff in Sri LankaAt least 21 people died and over 35 were injured after a government bus plunged off a cliff in Sri Lanka's Central Province.

2 arrested in Punjab for leaking classified Army info to Pak handler for moneyIn a major breakthrough in dismantling a cross-border espionage network, Punjab Police arrested two individuals for allegedly leaking classified Indian Army information to a Pakistani handler.

Mahesh Babu to share stage with Rajamouli, Jr NTR, Ram Charan at RRR London eventMahesh Babu will join the 'RRR' team members SS Rajamouli, Jr NTR and Ram Charan at the Royal Albert Hall in London on Sunday. Composer MM Keeravaani will perform with a live orchestra at the 'RRR' screening.

Aamir Khan, Ranveer Singh and celebs remember makeup artist Vikram GaikwadPopular Bollywood makeup artist Vikram Gaikwad died on Saturday. Aamir Khan, Ranveer Singh, Anushka Sharma and several others paid tribute to him.

The duo lashed out at Pakistan actors for their statements against Indian Armed Forces and Operation Sindoor.

sports.headline: Give Virat Kohli India Test captaincy for England series: Michael VaughanMichael Vaughan has made the bold claim that India should hand the Test captaincy to Virat Kohli for the upcoming England tour, which will begin on June 20. Kohli is considered as one of India's best Test captains of all time.

Arsenal fight back from 2-0 down to secure draw against LiverpoolArsenal fought back from a 2-0 deficit to claim a point against Liverpool at Anfield on Sunday, May 11. Despite going down to 10 men, Mikel Arteta's men showed character to hold on to the point.

Manchester United, Tottenham's Premier League woes continue ahead of Europa finalManchester United and Tottenham Hotspur's woes in the Premier League continued as they lost to West Ham United and Crystal Palace on Sunday, May 11. Both teams will faceoff in the Europa League final on May 21.

Just say India needs you, Virat Kohli will be available: Navjot Singh SidhuNavjot Singh Sidhu has claimed that Virat Kohli will forget about Test retirement and make himself available for the England tour if it is told that India needs him in the side. Sidhu feels Kohli gives balance to the Indian team.

Barcelona cleansweep Real Madrid in 2024-25, win 7-goal thrillerBarcelona overcame a 0-2 deficit to defeat Real Madrid 4-3 in a thrilling LaLiga match. This win strengthens their lead and boosts hopes of clinching the LaLiga title despite recent Champions League disappointment.

Lamine hits calma celebration, mocks Mbappe after scoring vs Real MadridBarcelona wonderboy Lamine Yamal scored a stunning curling goal in the El Clasico match on Sunday, May 11. His celebration echoed Cristiano Ronaldo's iconic 'calma', adding spice to the thrilling contest and taunting rivals.

RCB pacer Hazlewood's return for IPL 2025 in doubt after shoulder injury: ReportJosh Hazlewood's return for the remainder of the IPL 2025 season is in doubt as the Australian pacer is nursing an injury. Hazlewood has been in sensational form for RCB this season.

Jasprit Bumrah opts out of India Test captaincy race ahead of England tour: ReportJasprit Bumrah has opted out of the race to be India's Test team captain, according to a report from Sky Sports. Bumrah has been one of the names that was tipped for the post since Rohit Sharma announced his Test retirement.

India's 4x400m teams miss out on World Championship qualificationIndia's men's and mixed 4x400m relay teams failed to qualify for the World Championships in Tokyo. The teams now aim to secure the remaining berths through upcoming qualification events.

Watch: Hamburg fans invade pitch after Bundesliga promotion, 25 left hospitalised25 fans were left hospitalised after a pitch invasion happened following Hamburg's promotion to the Bundesliga on Saturday, May 10 after they defeated Ulm 6-1. Thousands of fans got on to the field with some suffering serious injuries.

Indian Test team after Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli: Possible squad for EnglandIndia prepares for a major transition ahead of the England Test series starting June 20. The retirement of Rohit Sharma and the possible exit of Virat Kohli marks a new leadership era under Shubman Gill.

Bumrah has been one of the names that was tipped for the post since Rohit Sharma announced his Test retirement.

Thousands of fans got on to the field with some suffering serious injuries.

Mandhana, Rana star as India hammer Sri Lanka by 97 runs to win tri-seriesIndia beat Sri Lanka by 97 runs in the final to win the tri-series in Colombo. Smriti Mandhana (116 off 101) and Sneh Rana (4/38) emerged as top performers in the commanding victory for the Women in Blue.

Not Kohli, but Jitesh was set to lead RCB vs LSG with Patidar injuredJitesh Sharma has revealed that he was about to captain RCB during their game against LSG on May 9, which was postponed after IPL 2025 was suspended for a week. RCB skipper Rajat Patidar was supposed to miss the game as he was nursing a finger injury.

Reports that international cricketers took off just hours ago from the Nur Khan military airbase in Rawalpindi before it was hit, tallies with India's charge.

Ricky Ponting convinced foreign players to stay back in India: PBKS CEO Satish MenonPunjab Kings (PBKS) CEO Satish Menon revealed that head coach Ricky Ponting convinced the foreign players to stay back in India amid the rising border tensions between India and Pakistan.

No pressure on Australian players to return to IPL as CA offers help: ReportsAccording to a report in Australian media, the Australia players will be under no pressure to return for the IPL as Cricket Australia will defend them to avoid any potential ban they could face for the snub.

Tendulkar's heartwarming message on Mother's Day: All started with her prayersLegendary India cricketer Sachin Tendulkar shared a heartwarming message for her mother on Mother's Day calling her the reason behind all of his success on the cricket field.

IPL 2025 set to resume by May 16, final likely on June 1: BCCI sourcesThe Indian Premier League 2025 is set to resume by May 16, a top BCCI official has told India Today. The final is expected to be held on either May 30, or June 1.

Ruben Dias, Manchester City trolled by Southampton after post-match remarkRuben Dias and Manchester City were brutally trolled by Southampton after the defender criticised the Saints after 0-0 draw on Saturday, May 10. Dias slammed Southampton for their approach during the game on Saturday.

IPL 2025 set to resume by May 16, final likely on June 1: BCCI sourcesThe Indian Premier League 2025 is set to resume by May 16, a top BCCI official has told India Today. The final is expected to be held on either May 30, or June 1.

Ruben Dias, Manchester City trolled by Southampton after post-match remarkRuben Dias and Manchester City were brutally trolled by Southampton after the defender criticised the Saints after 0-0 draw on Saturday, May 10. Dias slammed Southampton for their approach during the game on Saturday.

Deepika Kumari wins Bronze medal in Archery World Cup stage 2Deepika Kumari showcased grit and composure to clinch a bronze at the Archery World Cup Stage 2, avenging her semifinal loss with a strong finish. Her podium return added to India's growing medal tally, led by compound archers' dominance.

The drug Kagiso Rabada tested positive for was cocaine: ReportKagiso Rabada served a short doping ban during the IPL 2025. A news report coming out of South Africa states that the banned drug that Rabada used was cocaine.

Virat Kohli's old interview goes viral: Want smooth transition in Indian cricketAmid retirement reports of the star India batter Virat Kohli, his old interview has been going viral on social media where he could be seen talking about smooth transition in Indian cricket.

Banshee Unleashed: India's sprinting quartet roars, eyes on Asian gloryMeet the quartet of Gurindervir Singh, Animesh Kujur, Manikanta Hoblidhar and then in the final stretch, Amlan Borgohain, stoic, upright yet with shades of a banshee, a maelstrom of raw, untamed energy.

Smriti Mandhana hits 11th ODI hundred in Tri series final vs Sri LankaStar India batter Smriti Mandhana brought up her 11th ODI century in the tri-series final against Sri Lanka in Colombo. Mandhana scored a magnificent 116 (101) with the help of 15 fours and two sixes.

FC Barcelona vs Real Madrid: What the coaches said ahead of El ClasicoAs LaLiga title hopes hang in the balance, Real Madrid and Barcelona prepare for a high-voltage El Clasico, potentially Carlo Ancelotti's last, with both coaches rallying their squads for one final charge.

Virat Kohli please don't retire: Cricketers urge India star to extend Test stayAs India braces for a transition in Test cricket, the spotlight is firmly on Virat Kohli's next move. Former legends believe his presence remains pivotal for India's success in the red-ball format.

England's 2027 World Cup qualification in danger after ODI rankings updateThe England cricket team are in danger of not earning direct qualification for the ODI World Cup 2027 as they slipped to the eighth position after the annual rankings update by the ICC.

Virat Kohli afraid of England seamers? County cricket takes a dig at star batterThe official page of England's premier domestic first-class competition, County Championship, has taken a dig at Virat Kohli amid reports of his retirement from Test cricket.

All shine, no spine: Why Indian football is built for business, not growthThe glitzy Indian Super League may shine on the surface, but beneath the fireworks and packed stadiums lies a deeper issue: a league built more for profit than for nurturing talent and creating a sustainable football ecosystem.

Emotional Thomas Muller as Bayern lift Bundesliga title on his home farewellThe Allianz Arena erupted in tribute as Müller lifted the Bundesliga trophy one last time at home, closing a legendary chapter with Bayern Munich while fans and teammates honoured his unmatched legacy.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.
